article.headline: Robert Morris 74, Fairleigh Dickinson 50
article.story: HACKENSACK, N.J. -- Lijah Thompson scored 16 points and Karon Abraham added 12 to lead Robert Morris over Fairleigh Dickinson 74-50 on Thursday night. The Colonials (13-13, 9-6 Northeast Conference) led 28-18 at halftime despite shooting 9 of 26 from the floor (34.6 percent) in the opening half. Robert Morris continued to lead, 50-37, with 8:30 left to play before going on an 11-2 run, capped by a 3-pointer from Abraham with 6:23 to go. The Colonials improved to 56.7 percent from the field (17 of 30), including 5 of 6 beyond the arc (83.3 percent) in the second half. The Knights (4-22, 2-13) were led by Kamil Svrdlik's 12 points and eight rebounds. John Galvin and Ayotunde Oyeniyi each grabbed eight rebounds as well for Fairleigh Dickinson, which has lost 10 straight and 19 of its last 20 contests. Robert Morris outscored the Knights 34-18 in the paint and forced 17 turnovers.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
